document.docTitle: Celebargiolestes orri Vincent J. Kalkman 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Celebargiolestes Kennedy, 1925 (Odonata: Argiolestidae)

ix-1937
, F.C.D. leg.; 1♂ 2♀ , km 53 on road to Malino, Gowa, 10-ix-1941 , L. Coomans de Ruiter leg.; 2♂ 1♀ , Malino, 13−26-v-1949 , W.A. v.d. Noordam leg.; 5♂ 2♀ , Mt Lompobatang area, Malino, ravine, 1 100 m a.s.l., 04-vi −10-viii-1982 , M.A. Lieftinck leg.; 1♀ , Borong Rapoa [Borongroppoa], 21-viii-1949 , A. Diakonoff leg.; 1♀ , Biseang Labboro, 275m , 07-x-1983 , S. Scipio Periwono [difficult to read] leg.; 1♀ , E of Maros, Bantimurung area, Sg. Pattunguang Asue, fast flowing stream through disturbed forest on limestone, large boulders, ponded areas, clear water, 17−20-iv-1991 , J. van Tol leg.; 2♂ , 30 km E of Maros, Cakar Alam Labang near Desa Layia, tributary of Sg. Labang, fully shaded, little water between large rocks, steep valley, forest somewhat disturbed, 400–500 m a.s.l., 20-iv-1991 , J. van Tol leg.; 1♂ , 10 km NW Palopo, km 15 road Palopo–Rantepao, Salo Tandung, width 10 m a.s.l., large boulders, torrents, seepage areas, rather open secondary forest overhanging from bank, otherwise not shaded, 400 m a.s.l., 27-iv-1991 , J. van Tol leg.; 6♂ 1♀ , W of Palopo, Puncak Palopo, x-1993 , R. Yohan leg.; 16♂ 3♀ , 10 km WNW Palopo, near Tojambu, river above km 23 from Palopo, 800 m a.s.l., 29-x-1993 , R. Yohan leg.
The species is dedicated to Albert G. Orr (masculine singular genitive noun).

Legs − Coxae and trochanters dull orange-yellow. Femora brown, extensively black near knees and with black keel; tibiae and tarsi brown. Spines dark brown; femora with respectively 9, 9, 11–2 spines laterally; tibiae of fore legs with 10 smaller and 4 larger spines laterally; tibiae of mid and hind legs with 10 and 12 spines respectively laterally.

Wings − Venation black. Base hyaline but with a yellow tinge from discoidal cell onwards and a faint smoky outer border. Fw and Hw with 2 Ax; Fw with 35 Px and Hw with 30–33 Px. Ac in Fw level with Ax1. Brace vein absent. Pterostigma dark brown. Up to three rows of cells between anal vein and border of Fw and up to five in Hw. Fields between Ir2 and R3, between R3 and IR3, and between IR3 and R4 at distal end containing 3 or more rows of cells.

Abdomen − Pattern as in Figure 21 ; dark elements dark brown to black, pale elements yellow-brown. Anterior half of S1 blue with pruinosity, posterior half dark brown, S2 with dorsum black and sides pale yellow-brown, S3–7 dorsally largely dark, ventral and lower lateral area pale brown, anteriorly on each segment the pale brown reaches to the dorsum forming a dorsally broken ring covering approximately a fifth to a tenth of the segment. S9– 10 black, the latter strongly depressed in the middle, hind border of S10 without modifications. Appendages as shown in Figs 43–45 ; dark brown with base of lower appendages yellow. Lower appendages long, about half the length of the upper appendages, directed upwards and ending near the flange halfway the upper appendages. Genital ligula as in Figures 32–33 , ligula with shallow and apically broad cleft. Lateral lobes of ligula large with rounded tip but not constricted in the middle.
Measurements [mm] − Total length 47, abdomen 38, Fw 35; Hw 35; Fw pterostigma 1.9 (costal length), 2.6 (longest length); Hw pterostigma 2.0 (costal length), 2.8 (longest length).
Wings − Fw and Hw with 2 Ax; Fw with 30–35 Px and Hw with 25–33 Px. Measurements [mm] − Total length 46–51, abdomen 37–41, Fw 33–37, Hw 33–37.

Thorax − Pattern on prothorax, synthorax and legs as in male. Fw and Hw with 2 Ax; Fw with 27–30 Px and Hw with 25–27 Px. Pt cream white with a slight yellow tinge, outer border in older specimens mottled greyish-black.

Abdomen − Stockier and shorter than in male. Pattern largely as in male; dark parts are dark brown to black, pale parts are yellow-brown. S10 dorsally black but laterally largely pale brown, cerci and valvifer brown, shaped as in
C. cinctus
.
Measurements [mm] − Total length 39–41, abdomen 30–32, Fw 31–32; Hw 30–32.

Males are distinguished from other species of
Celebargiolestes
by the combination of the following characters: (i) labrum black; (ii) postclypeus and frons largely black; (iii) ligula with a shallow apical cleft; (iv) lower appendages long, about halve the length of the upper appendages and, when seen from lateral, with the tip reaching the level of the upper appendages.
